result.execSummary:
The defendant Paige Mj Valla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Count 2

Defendant, Paige Mj Valla with Attorney Gail Marie Metheny appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:55)
State calls Lindsey Field - sworn

Witness excused
State argues - requests termination from program
Metheny - argues not terminating, she's doing treatment at Arbor Place right now - needs another chance
Deft - believe she enrolled at Arbor Place April 9, stopped talking to everyone she talked to last time, not faking it to make it, has lost everything - wants to remain in treatment court

for Treatment Court Termination hearing

(11:59)
State - hearing on DOC agents letter re: prescriptions deft can't take in jail - deft is being monitored  - jail is appropriate & necessary
Frigo - addresses the court - requests two terms of jail time just run together
Brantner - necessary to get her mental health under control - no beds available at behavioral health
State - deft tested positive for prescripts that she's not prescribed for - no objection to having her in behavorial health facility
Schlough - spoke with Ms. Frigo and deft & her father - has significant concerns over her not receiving a required medication - maybe get her into inpatient facility (Sacred Heart)

COURT:  modifies joc of jail to 58 days jail to run consecutive
with last 30 days if Deft is in inpatient facility she can have day for day credit
from DOC and phone call from attorney Schlough re: hearing; scanned; to courtroom clerk for scheduling.

complete Treatment Court

AODA & follow thru and any treatment recommended thru Treatment Court
no alcohol
credit 10 days if revoked
